job_description:
Senior DevSecOps Engineer

We are seeking a Senior DevSecOps Engineer to lead our cybersecurity, infrastructure automation, and DevSecOps practices as we transition to a secure, scalable, and modern engineering environment. This role will strengthen 2Base’s security posture, modernize pipelines, and guide the team toward a secure-by-design culture. You will collaborate with engineering, product, and leadership teams to ensure systems, applications, and cloud environments are secure, reliable, and future-ready.

Key Responsibilities

  • Define, implement, and enforce security standards, policies, and best practices across cloud and on-prem environments.
  • Conduct security risk assessments, perform vulnerability scans, coordinate penetration testing, and execute mitigation plans.
  • Architect, maintain, and enhance secure CI/CD pipelines with automated compliance and governance checkpoints.
  • Promote a "Security First" culture across engineering, ensuring secure design and development practices.
  • Continuously monitor, detect, investigate, and respond to security threats, incidents, breaches, and anomalies.
  • Develop and mature Infrastructure-as-Code practices using Terraform, Ansible, and automation frameworks.
  • Design and lead secure cloud architectures across AWS, Azure, or GCP for scalable, compliant deployments.
  • Build, operate, and secure containerized environments using Docker and Kubernetes with enforced security baselines.
  • Implement secure monitoring, logging, SIEM, and alerting systems for infrastructure and application layers.
  • Improve system reliability, scalability, performance, and fault tolerance across critical workloads.
  • Mentor DevOps engineers in secure development, automation, and operational excellence.
  • Lead technical strategy, tool selection, process improvements, and DevSecOps roadmap execution.
  • Collaborate with BA, PM, and Engineering teams to align security, performance, and delivery objectives with organizational goals.

Required Skills & Experience

  • 4–8 years of experience in DevOps, Cloud, or Infrastructure engineering with strong security exposure.
  • Hands-on experience with CI/CD tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI, GitHub Actions).
  • Expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP cloud platforms with a focus on secure architecture.
  • Proficiency in Infrastructure-as-Code (Terraform, Ansible).
  • Experience securing Docker and Kubernetes environments.
  • Strong understanding of networking technologies (LAN/WAN, firewalls, VPN, load balancers).
  • Knowledge of security frameworks (OWASP, NIST, CIS Benchmarks).
  • Experience with monitoring/logging tools (Prometheus, Grafana, ELK, CloudWatch, SIEM).
  • Scripting skills (Python, Bash, Shell).
  • Excellent troubleshooting, analytical, and problem-solving abilities.
  • Strong communication and collaboration skills to influence engineering teams.

Contact: Apply by sharing your resume at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Lead secure DevSecOps practices, modernize pipelines, and architect cloud environments. Requires 4–8 years of experience in secure infrastructure automation.

job_description:
Senior Business Analyst

At 2Base, we are rebuilding the Business Analyst function into a world-class, product-minded, clarity-driven team. This role is not a documentation role. It is not a screen updater role. It is not a support role. This is a core Business Analyst position responsible for functional modelling, system reasoning, requirement clarity, and building the foundation for correct development.

As a Senior Business Analyst, you will be the functional brain of the project. You will ensure that the right problem is understood, broken down, analysed, validated, clarified, communicated, and owned end-to-end. You will drive requirement precision, reduce rework, and enable confident and aligned delivery across teams.

Key Responsibilities

  • Lead requirement workshops, client calls, and discovery discussions to understand business needs clearly.
  • Ask deeper questions, challenge assumptions, and validate the true business intent behind every requirement.
  • Convert ambiguous client inputs into structured, logical, and actionable functional understanding.
  • Break large features into modules, workflows, components, and clear dependencies.
  • Build strong system-level understanding involving APIs, integrations, data flow, and backend considerations.
  • Translate business processes into functional logic that development teams can execute.
  • Decompose requirements into use-case flows, system behaviours, edge cases, alternate paths, validation rules, and dependencies.
  • Prepare high-quality documentation, including BRD, FRD, SRS, workflows, state diagrams, data-flow diagrams, API requirement specs, and acceptance criteria.
  • Ensure all documentation is clear, logical, structured, testable, and ready for developers and QA to use.
  • Collaborate closely with developers, architects, QA, and product owners to validate feasibility and align understanding.
  • Ensure QA teams can derive test cases effectively from your functional logic and acceptance criteria.
  • Communicate confidently with clients, handle requirement discussions smoothly, and clarify misunderstandings immediately.
  • Push back politely on unclear or changing requirements and ensure final decisions are documented properly.
  • Maintain requirement traceability throughout the lifecycle and ensure zero ambiguity during handover to development.
  • Own the entire requirement lifecycle from discovery to development readiness with high accountability.
  • Drive clarity across teams by ensuring every requirement is complete, validated, and logically consistent.

Required Skills & Experience

  • Minimum 4+ years of core Business Analyst experience with strong analytical and system-level thinking.
  • Ability to break down complex requirements into clear components, workflows, and functional logic.
  • Excellent verbal and written communication with confidence in client interactions and clarifications.
  • Proven experience in preparing SRS, BRD, FRD, workflows, and acceptance criteria with high clarity.
  • Ability to challenge assumptions politely, ask the right questions, and ensure zero ambiguity.
  • Strong collaboration experience with development, QA, architects, and cross-functional teams.
  • Understanding of API behaviours, integrations, data flows, and multi-module system interactions.
  • Ability to run requirement discussions, workshops, and independently lead discovery sessions.
  • Exposure to SaaS, scalable products, automation, or AI-supported systems is an added advantage.
  • Demonstrated ownership of requirements end-to-end, ensuring developer-ready and testable outputs.
  • Not suitable for UI-only thinkers, passive communicators, template-based writers, or those relying on AI for answers.
  • Success is defined by clear, testable requirements, zero rework, strong cross-team alignment, and confident communication.
  • Candidates must align with 2Base’s structured thinking, clarity-driven culture, and transformation of the BA function.

Minimum Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, Business, or related field
  • 4 to 8 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst
  • Experience in SaaS or scalable product environments
  • Exposure to AI/Automation, integrations, or multi-module systems
  • Ability to run independent client workshops
  • Must have independently handled requirement ownership for at least one full project lifecycle

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Senior Business Analyst role focused on functional modeling, requirement clarity, and cross-team alignment. Own end-to-end requirements for scalable systems with zero ambiguity.

job_description:
Business Analyst

The Business Analyst plays a key role in ensuring requirements are clearly understood, accurately documented, and traceable throughout the software development lifecycle. This role focuses on translating business and functional inputs into structured, standardized documentation that supports effective development, testing, and delivery. Working closely with business analysts, design teams, and technical stakeholders, the role ensures consistency, clarity, and alignment across all requirement artifacts.

Key Responsibilities

  • Create Software Requirement Specifications (SRS) based on inputs from Core Business Analysts, stakeholder discussions, and requirement walkthroughs
  • Prepare Business Requirement Documents (BRD) using approved templates while ensuring business intent and system behavior are clearly documented
  • Participate in requirement discussions to understand business objectives, functional flows, dependencies, and assumptions before documentation
  • Analyze requirements to identify gaps, ambiguities, and inconsistencies, and work with Core BAs to resolve them
  • Document functional flows, business rules, and acceptance criteria where applicable to support development and QA teams
  • Document wireframes, UI flows, validations, and UI specifications in collaboration with design and product teams
  • Maintain change logs, version history, and document updates throughout the project lifecycle
  • Create and manage traceability matrices linking business, functional, and technical requirements
  • Maintain cross-references across BRD, SRS, UI, API, and related documentation
  • Ensure documentation consistency, completeness, and alignment with approved scope and delivery timelines
  • Ensure accurate and timely PMS updates with structured documentation details
  • Support development, QA, UAT, and audit processes through clear, traceable, and up-to-date documentation
  • Assist in requirement reviews, walkthroughs, and validation sessions with internal and client stakeholders

Requirements

Required Skills and Experience - 1 to 4 years of experience in Business Analysis documentation or related roles - Strong experience in BRD and SRS creation - Hands-on experience with documentation templates, standards, and version control - Ability to document UI wireframes and functional flows clearly - Working knowledge of APIs and system integrations for documentation purposes - Experience with project management systems and documentation tools - Strong attention to detail and ability to manage multiple documents in parallel - Excellent written communication and stakeholder coordination skills

Minimum Qualifications - Bachelor’s degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field - 1 to 4 years of experience as a Business Analyst or Product Analyst

Benefits

  • A growth-driven environment with opportunities to lead, innovate, and upskill continuously.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at careers@2basetechnologies.com.
summary: Translates business needs into structured documentation for software development. Ensures clarity, traceability, and alignment across requirements and stakeholder deliverables.

job_description:
DevOps Engineer (AWS & On-Prem)

We are seeking a DevOps Engineer to design, build, and operate reliable, secure, and cost-efficient infrastructure across AWS and on-premises environments. This hands-on, leadership-oriented role focuses on infrastructure provisioning, system reliability, CI/CD orchestration, container platforms, security controls, and cost optimization. You will collaborate with engineering and product teams to ensure scalable, observable, and resilient systems while mentoring junior DevOps engineers.

Key Responsibilities

Infrastructure & Platform Engineering

  • Design, provision, and manage infrastructure across AWS and on-prem environments using Infrastructure as Code (IaC).
  • Provision and manage Linux-based servers, virtual machines, and bare-metal systems.
  • Configure and manage network components including VPCs, subnets, routing, firewalls, load balancers, VPNs, and network switches (on-prem).
  • Lead setup and maintenance of PostgreSQL databases, including backups, replication, performance tuning, and high availability.

Containerization & Orchestration

  • Design, deploy, and operate Kubernetes clusters (EKS and/or self-managed).
  • Build and maintain Docker-based container workflows.
  • Manage Kubernetes workloads, namespaces, ingress, secrets, autoscaling, and rolling deployments.
  • Establish best practices for container security, image scanning, and runtime hardening.

CI/CD & Automation

  • Design and maintain CI/CD pipelines for application and infrastructure code.
  • Orchestrate automated builds, tests, deployments, and rollbacks.
  • Implement GitOps or pipeline-driven deployment strategies.
  • Write and maintain automation scripts using Bash, Python, or similar scripting languages.

Monitoring, Reliability & Operations

  • Implement system monitoring, logging, and alerting for infrastructure and applications.
  • Define and track SLIs/SLOs and lead incident response and root cause analysis.
  • Ensure high availability, fault tolerance, and disaster recovery readiness.
  • Lead operational runbooks and on-call best practices.

Security & Compliance

  • Implement infrastructure and platform security best practices.
  • Manage IAM, secrets, encryption, network security, and access controls.
  • Support vulnerability management, patching, and audit readiness.
  • Collaborate with security teams to align with compliance and governance requirements.

Cost Optimization & Performance

  • Monitor and optimize AWS cloud spend using cost visibility and reporting tools.
  • Identify opportunities for rightsizing, reserved instances, autoscaling, and storage optimization.
  • Track on-prem infrastructure utilization and capacity planning.
  • Balance performance, reliability, and cost trade-offs.

Leadership & Collaboration

  • Act as a technical lead and mentor for DevOps engineers.
  • Define DevOps standards, best practices, and documentation.
  • Partner with engineering teams to improve developer experience and deployment velocity.
  • Participate in architecture discussions and infrastructure roadmap planning.

Required Qualifications

  • 3+ years of hands-on experience in DevOps, SRE, or Platform Engineering roles.
  • Strong experience with AWS (EC2, VPC, IAM, RDS, EKS, S3, CloudWatch, etc.).
  • Proven experience managing on-prem infrastructure (servers, virtualization, networking).
  • Deep Linux system administration experience.
  • Hands-on experience with PostgreSQL administration.
  • Strong knowledge of Docker and Kubernetes.
  • Experience with CI/CD tools and infrastructure automation.
  • Proficiency in scripting (Bash, Python, or similar).
  • Strong understanding of infrastructure security principles.
  • Experience with monitoring, logging, and incident response.

Preferred / Nice-to-Have Qualifications

  • Experience with Infrastructure as Code tools (Terraform, CloudFormation, Ansible, etc.).
  • Experience operating hybrid or multi-cloud environments.
  • Exposure to GitOps, service meshes, or advanced Kubernetes patterns.
  • Prior experience leading or mentoring DevOps engineers.
  • Experience supporting regulated or compliance-driven environments.

What Success Looks Like

  • Stable, secure, and scalable infrastructure across AWS and on-prem.
  • Highly automated provisioning and deployment pipelines.
  • Strong observability and fast incident resolution.
  • Measurable reductions in cloud and infrastructure costs.
  • Improved developer velocity and platform reliability.

Contact: If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, kindly share your updated resume with us at career@aabasoft.com.
summary: A DevOps Engineer role requiring AWS and on-prem infrastructure expertise, CI/CD automation, container orchestration, and leadership in mentoring teams to ensure scalable, secure, and cost-efficient systems.

job_description:
About Us

Muthoot Mercantile Limited is a leading Non-Banking Financial Company (NBFC) headquartered in Thiruvananthapuram, Kerala. The company is registered with the RBI as an NBFC and primarily operates in the gold loan sector. The company emphasizes trust, transparency, and customer relationships, particularly because it handles customers' valuable gold assets. Muthoot Mercantile has a wide branch network across several Indian states, including Kerala, Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra, Odisha, Punjab, Uttar Pradesh, Haryana, West Bengal, and Delhi among others.

Position Overview

We are seeking a proactive and results-driven Senior Software Engineer - .NET with a strong background in .NET development. The ideal candidate should possess hands-on experience in .NET Core, MVC, WPF, WCF, Angular or React, SQL, and Azure, and be capable of providing technical support to a talented group of developers.

Key Responsibilities

  • Mentor junior team members.
  • Provide timely code reviews for peers.
  • Develop high-quality software solutions using .NET Core, Angular or React, MS SQL, and Azure technologies.
  • Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand project requirements and translate them into technical specifications.
  • Stay updated with the latest .NET technologies, frameworks, and best practices.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues across the application stack.
  • Actively participate in scrum meetings and analyze requirements to understand technical/functional needs. Discuss requirements directly with clients.
  • Work independently as an individual contributor.
  • Assign tasks to junior team members and guide their development.
  • Manage and prioritize project tasks after discussing with clients, ensuring deadlines are met and milestones achieved.
  • Participate in project planning, estimation, and documentation processes.
  • Understand code in other technology projects and convert them into .NET projects if required.
  • Be ready to learn new technologies.
  • Demonstrate commitment to completing tasks on time without follow-ups from seniors.
  • Learn the technology/business domain and system domain as recommended by the project.
  • Code, debug, test, document, and communicate product/component/feature development stages.
  • Ensure code reviews, unit testing, and integration testing are completed efficiently and effectively.

Preferred Skills & Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience).
  • Minimum 5+ years of experience in .NET technology.
  • Proficiency in .NET Core, C#, .NET MVC, WPF, WCF, Web API.
  • Strong expertise in frontend technologies including Angular or React, TypeScript, HTML, CSS, and JavaScript.
  • Experience in cloud technologies, particularly Azure services (e.g., Azure App Service, Azure Functions).
  • Knowledge of Azure DevOps is a plus.
  • Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to troubleshoot complex technical challenges.
  • Strong communication skills and the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
  • Familiarity with version control systems, especially Git.
  • Proven ability to work as an individual contributor.
  • Experience with Agile methodologies like Scrum is a plus.

What We Offer

  • Competitive salary.
  • Excellent career growth opportunities and exposure to multiple technologies.
  • PF/ESI/Medical Insurance.
  • A collaborative and innovative work environment.

How to Apply

If you are a motivated and experienced Senior Software Engineer - .NET seeking a challenging opportunity to contribute to a leading NBFC group, apply with a detailed resume to hr@muthootenterprises.com with the subject line Application for Senior Software Engineer - .NET. Include information on your notice period, current, and expected CTC.

About the Opportunity

DeviceDriven is seeking a Senior DevOps / SRE Engineer to build, operate, and improve a reliable, secure, and scalable cloud platform using GCP, Kubernetes, Infrastructure-as-Code, and GitOps practices. This role emphasizes production ownership, automation, and reliability engineering, with a focus on real systems over design reviews.

Role Overview

We require a hands-on DevOps/SRE engineer with expertise in: - Cloud infrastructure (primarily GCP) - Kubernetes-based platforms - Terraform and automation - CI/CD pipelines - Observability, incident response, and reliability engineering

Key Responsibilities

Cloud Infrastructure & Operations (GCP + Multi-Cloud)

  • Operate and support cloud infrastructure across dev, staging, and production environments.
  • Implement networking, IAM, security, and compute resources on GCP.
  • Support multi-cloud workloads (AWS/Azure exposure is a plus).
  • Participate in capacity planning and cost optimization.

Infrastructure-as-Code & Automation

  • Build and maintain infrastructure using Terraform.
  • Contribute to reusable Terraform modules and IaC standards.
  • Automate provisioning, updates, and validations.
  • Migrate manual/legacy setups to automated IaC workflows.

Kubernetes & Platform Engineering

  • Operate production-grade Kubernetes clusters (GKE or equivalent).
  • Deploy workloads using Helm/Kustomize.
  • Support rollout strategies (rolling, blue-green, canary).
  • Implement Kubernetes security best practices (RBAC, network policies, secrets).

CI/CD & GitOps

  • Build/maintain CI/CD pipelines (GitHub Actions, Azure DevOps, etc.).
  • Automate build/test/deployment workflows.
  • Support GitOps-based deployment models.
  • Improve pipeline reliability, security, and speed.

SRE: Reliability, Observability & Incident Management

  • Design/monitor systems using Prometheus, Datadog, OpenTelemetry.
  • Define/track SLIs/SLOs for critical services.
  • Participate in on-call rotations and incident response.
  • Perform RCA and implement preventive fixes.
  • Improve system resilience via automation.

Security & Compliance Support

  • Implement cloud security best practices (IAM, secrets management, encryption, network isolation).
  • Collaborate on vulnerability remediation and audits.
  • Support compliance requirements (PCI/SOX preferred, not mandatory).

Required Skills & Qualifications

Core Technical Skills: - 5+ years in DevOps, SRE, or Cloud Infrastructure. - Strong GCP experience (GKE, VPC, IAM, Cloud SQL). - Solid Kubernetes production experience. - Strong Terraform skills (state management, modules, environments). - CI/CD pipeline experience with modern tooling. - Cloud security fundamentals. - Observability tool experience.

Programming & Scripting: - Bash proficiency. - Python/Go knowledge for automation/debugging.

Nice to Have: - Fintech or regulated environment experience. - AWS/Azure production exposure. - Platform engineering/internal tooling familiarity. - Incident management framework/postmortem experience.

How to Apply

Send your resume, GitHub/LinkedIn profile, and a short note to: jobs@devicedriven.com

Responsibilities

Data Ingestion & Integration

  • Design and configure ingestion connectors for 15+ data sources (REST APIs, webhooks, database replication, event streams)
  • Implement event-driven architecture for real-time data collection (e.g., Kafka, EventBridge, Pub/Sub)
  • Handle authentication, rate limiting, schema evolution, and error recovery
  • Validate data at ingestion (schema checks, completeness, freshness)

Data Modeling & Transformation

  • Build Bronze → Silver → Gold data transformation pipelines
  • Implement Slowly Changing Dimensions (SCD2) to track historical changes
  • Design dimension and fact tables optimized for analytics and traceability
  • Implement data quality tests, documentation, and automated lineage tracking
  • Optimize partitioning, compression, and query performance

Serving & Access Patterns

  • Populate relational databases with aggregated metrics (e.g., velocity, defect rates, test coverage)
  • Implement graph data models for traceability (requirements ↔ code ↔ tests ↔ releases)
  • Build search indices for full-text queries (code commits, requirements, incidents)
  • Design APIs or views for downstream consumers (dashboards, agents)

Orchestration & Monitoring

  • Implement workflow orchestration (DAGs) with dependency management, retries, SLAs
  • Build observability into pipelines: metrics (latency, row counts, failures), logs, lineage diagrams
  • Create data quality dashboards and alerting (freshness, completeness, schema drift)
  • Document runbooks for incident response and troubleshooting

Infrastructure & Security

  • Provision cloud infrastructure using Infrastructure as Code (Terraform, CloudFormation, Pulumi)
  • Implement least-privilege IAM, VPC security, secrets management, encryption at rest/in transit
  • Design cost-efficient architectures (storage lifecycle policies, compute right-sizing, query optimization)
  • Ensure compliance with data governance and GDPR/ASPICE requirements
  • Set up CI/CD for infrastructure and pipeline code (GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, Azure DevOps)

Preferred Skills

  • 7+ years in data engineering roles, with at least 2 years building lakehouse architectures (Bronze/Silver/Gold or equivalent medallion patterns)
  • Proven track record delivering production-grade data platforms supporting 50+ data sources and 100+ users
  • Experience with graph databases (Neo4j, Amazon Neptune, TigerGraph) for relationship modeling
  • Hands-on with stream processing (Kafka, Flink, Spark Streaming, Kinesis)

Technical Skills (Core)

  • Cloud Platforms: Deep expertise in AWS, Azure, or GCP data services (S3/Blob, RDS/SQL Database, managed Kafka, serverless compute)
  • SQL & Data Modeling: Expert-level SQL, dimensional modeling, SCD2, normalization vs. denormalization trade-offs
  • Transformation Tools: dbt, Databricks SQL, Dataform, or custom SQL/Python frameworks
  • Programming: Python or Scala for data processing, scripting, and automation
  • Orchestration: Airflow, Prefect, Dagster, Step Functions, or Azure Data Factory
  • IaC: Terraform, CloudFormation, Pulumi, or ARM templates

Technical Skills (Preferred)

  • Search: OpenSearch, Elasticsearch, or Solr for text indexing and retrieval
  • Graph: Neo4j Cypher, SPARQL, or Gremlin for graph queries; experience with graph ETL
  • Data Quality: Great Expectations, dbt tests, or custom validation frameworks
  • Real-time: Flink, Spark Streaming, or serverless event processing (Lambda, Cloud Functions)
  • Monitoring: Grafana, Datadog, or CloudWatch for data pipeline observability
